alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 11 at 7:05PM CDT until August 11 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ROGERS...EAST CENTRAL OSAGE...CENTRAL WASHINGTON AND SOUTHWESTERN NOWATA COUNTIES... At 704 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Dewey to 2 miles northwest of Ochelata, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Nowata... Dewey... Delaware... Watova... Bartlesville Municipal Airport... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
